alert.note: Alert for Franklin (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 01 at 9:12AM EDT until May 02 at 7:00AM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of Maine, including the following counties, Franklin, Oxford and Somerset. Portions of northern New Hampshire, including the following county, Coos. * WHEN...Until 200 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 910 AM EDT, Runoff from excessive rainfall has caused small stream rises across the area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Eustis, Rangeley, Rumford, Kingfield, Bingham, Andover, Carrabassett Valley, Errol, Phillips and Weld.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
